content.question: The enactment of the 1870 Education Act described in the passage is best understood as part of the

choices.label: growth of nongovernmental education reform movements
increasing influence of Marxist critiques of economic inequality
assertion of conservative political values after the Congress of Vienna
intervention of governments into daily life to advance social and economic polices

content.answer: intervention of governments into daily life to advance social and economic polices

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
